poem:
Handbags and Human Touch  

In pockets of Tehran's whispered reels,  
a handbag unfurls its quiet secrets,  
the stitched leather cradling absence,  
while two worlds, split by celluloid,  
find the tender dissonance of touch.  
Maryam's vision, a tapestry of longing,  
where every frame is an echo—  
a gentle break, a cinematic embrace.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Iranian artist Maryam Tafakory wins the 2024 Film London Jarman award Iranian artist Maryam Tafakory has won this year’s Film London Jarman award, which recognises British excellence in the field of moving image. Tafakory took the £10,000 prize for her work, which combines found footage with the cinematic traditions of post-revolutionary Iran. Her 2020 film Irani Bag used a split-screen technique to show how handbags were often deployed in films as stand-ins for human touch.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
